newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Antenna Hungaria to start first digital broadcasts.
newsitem.headline: Antenna Hungaria to start first digital broadcasts.

text.p: Hungary's national broadcasting company Antenna Hungaria Rt is to start its first digital satellite broadcast on September 10, company officials said on Wednesday.
"We have signed an eight-year contract to broadcast TV3's programme to cable operators countrywide," Istvan Mate, general director of Antenna Hungaria, told a news conference.
Antenna Hungaria in which the state has an 83.2 percent stake, broadcasts all transmissions of Hungarian state television and radio.
Andras Feuer, general director of TV3, a commercial station for Budapest launched in November 1994, said the deal will give his channel the opportunity to reach a larger audience, said
"We hope to reach some three million viewers as a results, and we are targeting a 10 percent advertising market share," Feuer said.
With an estimated 1.5 million viewers per week, the station is still in the red, and Feuer said this is in line with plans.
"We have spent some two billion forints and our original plans included a three-year loss-making period. Now, he have the chance to start making a profit earlier than envisaged," he said.
